identification.cap: Convex to centrally depressed shallowly vase-shaped, 2-5.5 inches across, concentric zones orangish brownish-orange tan, moist sticky dirty green stains age bruise.
identification.gills: Decurrent close to crowded narrow, dull orange deepening age, bleed dark red to purplish latex stains green exposure.
identification.stem: Colored like cap, 0.79-2.36 inches tall, 0.39-0.98 inches thick, solid brittle young hollow age, bruises green, whitish bloom base.
identification.flesh: Whitish fairly firm, stains pink to purplish sliced, slightly acrid or mild taste, faintly aromatic odor.
identification.latex: Sparse dark red to purplish-red remains dark exposure.
identification.microscopic: Spores ellipsoid 7-10 × 5.5-7.5 µm amyloid warts partial reticulation; pileipellis ixocutis; hymenial macrocystidia up to 70 µm.

habitat: Mycorrhizal with Douglas-fir pines, scattered to gregarious forest floors conifer duff, summer-fall Rocky Mountains, fall-winter West Coast, western North America, younger stands Douglas-fir pine range coniferous habitats.
